description: At least 20,000 Palestinians in Gaza have been reported killed in the war, according to Hamas.
maintext: By contrast, US-led coalition air and artillery strikes killed fewer than 20 civilians per day, on average, during the four-month offensive to drive IS out of the Syrian city of Raqqa in 2017, according to Amnesty International. It is unclear how many civilians lived there at the time, but UN officials estimated that there were between 50,000 and 100,000. Additionally, over 160,000 civilians reportedly fled their homes and became internally displaced at the time.
title: Israel Gaza: What Gaza's death toll says about the war
